ygData.subject: Another New Publication: Novelty Search with GP
ygData.msgSnippet: Technically, this post is off-topic since it actually doesn t involve NEAT, but it does provide further evidence for the credibility of the novelty search

Technically, this post is off-topic since it actually doesn't involve NEAT,=
 but it does provide further evidence for the credibility of the novelty se=
arch approach with which NEAT and HyperNEAT will likely often be combined i=
n the future.  

Joel Lehman and I also will present this second paper conc=
erning novelty search at GECCO this year in the GP track; its title is, "Ef=
ficiently Evolving Programs through the Search for Novelty."  As you can gu=
ess, the main result is that novelty search works better than fitness-based=
 search with some benchmark problems in GP as well:

http://eplex.cs.ucf.ed=
u/publications/2010/lehman.gecco10b.html
Direct link: http://eplex.cs.ucf.e=
du/papers/lehman_gecco10b.pdf

We hope that this result with GP will increa=
se awareness of the novelty search algorithm and its implications for EC in=
 general, although we remain focused primarily on NEAT and its extensions.
=

ken
